snippet: Mariano Rivera, who faces surgery to repair the anterior cruciate ligament in his right knee, said Friday afternoon that he would come back to pitch for the Yankees next year.
abstract: New York Yankees closer Mariano Rivera, facing surgery to repair anterior cruciate ligament in his right knee, declares that he will return to pitch for the Yankees next year; news lifts gloom in the Yankees clubhouse and replaces it with relief.
lead_paragraph: Mariano Rivera, who faces surgery to repair the anterior cruciate ligament in his right knee, said Friday afternoon that he would come back to pitch for the Yankees next year.

headline.seo: Rivera Says He Will Pitch in 2013
headline.main: Yankees’ Rivera Vows to Overcome Knee Injury
headline.print_headline: ‘I’m coming back. Write it down in big letters.’
